data.event: In the colonial period, what is now Vermont was disputed territory, with land claims from both New York and New Hampshire.

event.title: issued by the Royal Governor of New York in 1767

data.event: The original grants for this area, issued by the Royal Governor of New York in 1767 and 1772, were for two towns.

event.title: 1777, the Republic of Vermont was established

data.event: But in 1777, the Republic of Vermont was established.
Ignoring the previous grants, it gave charter on November 7, 1780 for “a tract of vacant land within this state which has not heretofore been granted.”
